intro: Ipomoea coscinosperma, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet, often appearing in clusters. It is a vine that can grow up to several meters in length, with hairy stems and tendrils for climbing. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, round seeds.
